adjectives.description: chargeable (comparative more chargeable, superlative most chargeable)

entries.meaning: (of expenses etc.) That may be charged to an account.
examples: In summary, the variation of a lease for consideration is generally chargeable to SDLT.

entries.meaning: (rare) Liable to be accused (either formally or informally).

examples: These cruelties are not, indeed, chargeable on Mr. Hastings personally; but when I state, that he levied an unjust war, the consequences that follow he is guilty of.
